article: Stefan and Erika Svanstrom on a four-month honeymoon were hit by several natural disasters, including the Australian floods, Christchurch earthquake and Japanese tsunami. The  _  couple left Sweden on December 6 and were  _  caught in Munich, Germany, due to one of Europe's worst snowstorms. Later, they flew on to Australia which then  _  with one of the most terrible hurricanes in the nation's history. From there, the couple,  in panic  , were forced to  _  for 24 hours on the floor of a shopping centre with 2500 others. "Trees were being  knocked over  and big branches were scattered across the streets," Stefan told Sweden's Expressen newspaper. "We  _  escaped" The couple then flew to Christchurch, New Zealand.  _  their arriving, a massive earthquake  measuring  magnitude 6.3 hit the city on February 22. Erika said "We could not visit the city since it was completely in  _  , so instead we travelled around before going to Japan." But days after the Svanstroms arrived, Tokyo was  _  by Japan's largest earthquake  _  records began. "The trembling was horrible and we saw roof debris fly off the buildings," Mr. Svantrom said. "  _  seemed the buildings were swaying  back and forth  ." The family returned to Sweden on March 29 after a(n)  _  calmer visit to their last destination China. But Mr. Svanstrom, who also survived the very tsunami  _  hit Southeast Asia in 2004, said "I know marriages have to experience some  _  , but I think we have  got through  most of them." ,  adding  that the marriage had become strong. "We've certainly experienced  more than  our fair share of catastrophes, but the most important thing is that we're together and happy." said the couple.
